intro: Psychrogeton nabidshonii, commonly known as the Afghan snowbean, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
